fullText: Though “Harmony” is dampened by its formulaic adherence to melancholic moments and a tragedy-laden chronicling of Jewish heritage, this is a show that successfully completes the task at hand. By its end, a palpable grief radiates throughout the Ethel Barrymore Theatre — a palpable shame, as well. One that hopefully urges us to remember our dead and to do everything — everything — in our power to keep their stories alive.

keyPhrases.quote: dampened by its formulaic adherence to melancholic moments and a tragedy-laden chronicling
this is a show that successfully completes the task at hand
a palpable grief radiates throughout the Ethel Barrymore Theatre

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: Despite criticizing formulaic elements, the critic acknowledges the show succeeds in its emotional mission and creates powerful theatrical impact. | GPT-4o-mini: The review acknowledges both strengths and weaknesses, indicating a mixed-positive sentiment overall.
